pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:5.1: 52. The training rule on licking the hands
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating licking their hands. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:7.1: “‘I will not eat licking my hands,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:8.1: One should not eat licking the hands.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect eats licking his hands, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:9.2): if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk52:10.1: The second training rule is finished.
